docs.snippet: The Indiana Legislature convened at 9 o'clock this morning. The Lien enant-Governor was absent on account of ill health. The Senate organized by the election of J. R. CRAVENS President and by choosing the same Secretary, Assistant-Secretary. Clerks...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Indiana Legislature convened at 9 o'clock this morning. The Lien enant-Governor was absent on account of ill health. The Senate organized by the election of J. R. CRAVENS President and by choosing the same Secretary, Assistant-Secretary. Clerks and Doorkeepers as were elected at the extra session.

docs.snippet: Arrival of the Steamship Cahawba. The United States Mail steamship Cahawba, J. D. BULLOGH, commander, from New-Orleans via Havana, arrived yesterday afternoon, bringing dates from the latter place to the 31st ult. We glean very scanty intelligence...
docs.lead_paragraph: Arrival of the Steamship Cahawba. The United States Mail steamship Cahawba, J. D. BULLOGH, commander, from New-Orleans via Havana, arrived yesterday afternoon, bringing dates from the latter place to the 31st ult. We glean very scanty intelligence from them, however.

docs.snippet: A telegram from New-Haven, yesterday, announced the decision of the Court in the Bennett Divorce case, granting the petition of Mrs. BENNETT. We copy from the New-Haven Journal and Courier the decision of Judge WALDO in full:

headline.main: THE BENNETT DIVORCE CASE.; DECISION OF JUDGE WALDO. Divorce Granted to Mrs. Beanelt.

docs.lead_paragraph: A telegram from New-Haven, yesterday, announced the decision of the Court in the Bennett Divorce case, granting the petition of Mrs. BENNETT. We copy from the New-Haven Journal and Courier the decision of Judge WALDO in full:

docs.snippet: The, ice-bridge over the St. Lawrence connecting Montreal and Longueil, was firmly established on the 31st lt. As the mercury was 16[degree] below zero, it was believed the bridge could not be disturbed Deforo Spring. Mr. Wm. Torrey, a resident of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The, ice-bridge over the St. Lawrence connecting Montreal and Longueil, was firmly established on the 31st lt. As the mercury was 16[degree] below zero, it was believed the bridge could not be disturbed Deforo Spring. Mr. Wm. Torrey, a resident of Quincey, Mass., of Independent circumstances, hung himself Jan. 1. He was 60 years of age. Ill health is supposed to have been the cause of his act.

headline.main: ARIZONA AND SONORA.; General Appearance, Character and Prospects of the Country.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: Arizona and contiguous regions, are now to considerable extent, attracting public attention For purposes of legislation and private enterprise information respecting Arizona, Sonora, , is: sought after with avidity.

docs.snippet: Bourd of Aldermen. ORGANIZATION OF THE NEW BOARD-ALDERMAN MOSPEDON ELECTED PRESIDENT, AND D. T. VALENTINE CLERK--REGISTRATION OF ALDERMAN CLANCY. At 12 o'clock M. Yesterday the Alderman's chamber was densely thronged, and a few minutes after that...

headline.main: THE NEW CITY GOVERNMENT.; MAYOR TIEMANN'S MESSAGE Organization of the Common Council. Election of Presidents in Both Boards.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bourd of Aldermen. ORGANIZATION OF THE NEW BOARD-ALDERMAN MOSPEDON ELECTED PRESIDENT, AND D. T. VALENTINE CLERK--REGISTRATION OF ALDERMAN CLANCY. At 12 o'clock M. Yesterday the Alderman's chamber was densely thronged, and a few minutes after that hour the members of the new Board were in their seats.

docs.snippet: THIRD DAY. The Association met at the Lyceum, at 9 o'clock A.M., Thursday morning, President PHELPS in the Chair. Prayer by the Rev. Mr. BARTLETT. A resolution was offered by Mr. JOHNSON, in favor of reducing school sessions to five hours per day....
docs.lead_paragraph: THIRD DAY. The Association met at the Lyceum, at 9 o'clock A.M., Thursday morning, President PHELPS in the Chair. Prayer by the Rev. Mr. BARTLETT. A resolution was offered by Mr. JOHNSON, in favor of reducing school sessions to five hours per day. The resolution was opposed, and finally lost.

headline.main: The New Gold Fields of the United States.; KANSAS MINES. Kansas and Nebraska Mines--Gold Every-where Abundant--The Climate Mild--Rich Diggings in Prospect--Land Fertile--Timber Plenty--Towers Springing up--Country Fine and Salubrious--Preparations for a Large Emigration in the Spring.

docs.snippet: We publish to-day a very able and interesting paper on the present condition and prospective importance of our great Canal system, in the shape of a memorial addressed by the Canal Board of this State to Congress, praying that the harbors at Buffalo...
docs.lead_paragraph: We publish to-day a very able and interesting paper on the present condition and prospective importance of our great Canal system, in the shape of a memorial addressed by the Canal Board of this State to Congress, praying that the harbors at Buffalo and Oswego on the Lakes Erie and Ontario may be put into perfect order by the National Government;
